intro: Strychnos pungens, commonly known as the poison gooseberry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Loganiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange berries that resemble small gooseberries. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Its berries contain toxic alkaloids, including strychnine and brucine, which are highly poisonous to humans and animals. Despite its toxicity, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance.
